page.title: 16DEVELOPMENT OF N.BRISTOL
page.content: {Pen Park Hole}is believed to be the second largest cavern in the country. It's dome is at least 70m.high,70m. long & 40m.wide.It has claimed at least 2 lives, Cpt.Sturmey who died of a fever in 1682 3 days after visiting, & Rev.T.Newnham who fell in 1775. Known as Hell's Kitchen the hole was sealed up in 1962. Sited near new homes -Fairways on Pen Park Rd. {Village}that{died:}First flown in Sept 1949, the{Brabazon}remains the largest land plane ever built in Britain. However to enable the runway to be enlarged, the village of{Charlton }was destroyed. In August 1946 30 houses,a chapel,post office,shop, duck pond & common disappeared under the new runway.{Charlton }was not lost in vain. Result:greater employment & building of{Concorde},the world's first supersonic passenger plane.
